did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Programs, photographs, advertisements, clippings, reports, and a certificate.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Athletic event programs, photographs, annual reports, advertisements, plaques, cups, films and clippings concerning various Cornell athletic events, including women's athletics, and a certificate of incorporation of the Cornell Athletic Association.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Athletic event programs, photographs, annual reports, advertisements, plaques, cups, films and clippings concerning various Cornell athletic events, including women's athletics, and a certificate of incorporation of the Cornell Athletic Association. Also Cornell Victorious, the Cornell Campaign for Athletics, ca. 1990, V-790; Design plans for the Bartels Hall (formerly Alberding Field House), V-6028; Illini Reflections, ca. 1990 overview of past University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign events and life as presented by past university alumni. Included are Judi Ford-Johnson '73, Roger Ebert '64, Roger Plummer '84, Lester Leutwiler '29, Tom Haller '58, Ray Nitschke '58, and Dick Butkus '64, V-6029. Films include: Here We Are Again, 2 copies, ca. 1985, film about the history of Cornell athletics, F-478, 479; Stanford Today, 1985, film about Stanford University and its athletic programs, F-480. Also slides from the 1974 Cornell and Cornellians presentation by Laurence Koplik.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell Athletics Records, #40-1-370. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Related collections: Football Miscellany, 37-5-3981; Crew Records, 40-1-924; Hockey Films and Ephemera Collection, 40-4-3590; Football motion pictures, 40-2-2205; Track And Field Collection, 40-9-1820.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Sports Programs and Team Booklets
Boxes 1-4, 7, 9, 10

Series II. Reports and Handbooks
Boxes 5, 6

Series III. Notes, Memos, and Brochures
Box 6

Series IV. Articles and Clippings
Boxes 5, 6, 8

Series VII. Movie Films, Videos and other media
Box 9

Series VIII. Plaques and cups
Museum items (MU)

did.unittitle: Series I. Sports Programs and Team Booklets

scopecontent.p: Includes Constitution and By-Laws of the Cornell University Athletic Association, 1916
Includes Rules and Regulations Governing Athletics In Cornell University, issued by the Council on Physical Education and Athletics, 1939.
Includes Athletics Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony programs 1979-1984
Includes an envelope to L.C. Jackson from the Cornell B.B. Association, R.C. McCormick manager, January 30, 1891.
-includes November 1916, October 1930, War time imagery October 1942 (including at Syracuse game), 1943, 1946 (Thanksgiving game), 1952, 1965, 1968, 1979

scopecontent.p: Slide show made as part of a presentation by Laurence Koplik '72 and the Cornell Office of Public Information, visual Services and Radio-TV Film. Dedicated to Morris Bishop. Features many photos of various student activities on campus, but particularly athletic teams and coaches.

did.unittitle: Two photo albums showing renovation of Schoellkopf field, crescent bleachers, press box, Hoy field and Alumni fields.
Binder of slides showing Athletic Facilities Study ca. 1983, shows maps of various Cornell athletics facilities and proposals for future expansion.
Cornell Victorious, the Cornell Campaign for Athletics [VHS]
Design plans for the Bartels Hall (formerly Alberding Field House) [VHS]

scopecontent.p: Overview of past University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign events and life as presented by past university alumni. Included are Judi Ford-Johnson '73, Roger Ebert '64, Roger Plummer '84, Lester Leutwiler '29, Tom Haller '58, Ray Nitschke '58, and Dick Butkus '64.
Home soccer game on alumni field.
Film about the history of Cornell athletics.
Film about Stanford University and its athletic programs.
